description:
I can't put my finger on it, but something's changed for the better since I've been here last. Service is still a bit of a hit or miss and the ambiance looks much the same, perhaps just a bit brighter inside...but overall this last trip was really quite good.

We began our meal with the giant clams. 2 orders was still very hefty for an appetizer. Each serving comes with a generous portion of sliced, sweet surf clams and a half sea scallop tossed in vermicelli noodles mixed with minced garlic and chopped cilantro for flavor. Sweet soy sauce infused with jalapenos is served on the side. Flavors were absolutely on point and texture was also very good - I was impressed by this serving, especially since this was also not a top tier Chinese restaurant.  I'd definitely recommend this dish.

Next came the salt and pepper spareribs. They are thinner than most banquet restaurants, but where they lack some meatiness they certainly hit the mark in terms of flavor and crispiness. Some places are too meaty while others use a batter that's too thick. Neither of those are true at Oriental....they likely have a light cornstarch dressing that's they thrown into the deep fryer before being tossed in kosher and white pepper. It was really quite good.

Then came the salted pork congee. At $13 this sounds like a ripoff but the portion size is otherworldly, easily double that of most restaurants. They also throw in the salted pork bones which have a little meat that's then heavily salted for flavor. These bones are really the gems of the dish though since they are the source of flavor. So go ahead, gnaw on them a little.

Last but not least was the beef and tomato pan fried noodles. I loved how many fresh quartered tomatoes they added in along with bell peppers and onions. The gravy was very good - not too thick and just enough to coat the majority of the noodles but still leave crispy parts. 

Overall good meal. I think they've definitely redeemed themselves for now.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
My friend made a reservation for 10 for July 3 at 6pm, and we got there, there weren't that many people there, so if you are looking for a place to eat around 6pm, no need to make a reservation. 

Cleanliness: (2/5)
First off, this place is nothing fancy and is pretty much a hole in the wall. Don't expect much, other than a few flies flying around your food, ready to dive right in, or when you least expect it, to dive right into your bowl of soup, which is what happened to one of my friends. His soup was hot, and so he was mixing up the soup and then suddenly a fly just flew right into the soup. At least the server got him a new bowl...

Food: (3/5)
The food is average food, except for the duck, which looked and tasted decent.
The food we ordered:
- duck with hoisin sauce/buns: (3.75/5) decent duck with fluffy buns
- Deep fried calamari: (1/5) not crispy and kinda hard, a definite pass
- salt and pepper pork chop: (3/5) average
- Mongolian beef: (3/5) decent, not spicy
- stir fried green beans: (3/5) salty but good
- bok choy with mushrooms: (3/5) ok
- crispy half chicken: (2.5/5) kinda dry and the deep fried chips weren't all cooked all the way
- Singaporean noodles: (2.5/5) slight curry flavor but otherwise bland
- beef tendon claypot: (3/5) decent
- Oysters with Black Bean Sauce: (2.75/5) ok, but it was a little sandy inside...
- Walnut shrimp: (3/5) ok flavor, but they cheaped out and gave peanuts instead of walnuts. The peanuts were also regular and not like the candied walnuts it usually comes with...

For dessert, they gave some free slices of oranges and those orange slices were nice, juicy and sweet. Unfortunately, there wasn't any red bean or tapioca for dessert...

Would I come back? Not really... There are many more/better Chinese restaurants better than this one so I'd rather try another one, than to go back to this one... Overall, more like a 2.5/5 star kind of place...
author: Gilda W.

description:
I ordered to go for the first time last night at 9 pm, and the food was pretty bad. I got walnut shrimp, salt and pepper oysters, and shrimp paste "ong choy." They used cashews, not walnuts, and the shrimp was completely over fried and very dry. The oysters were very small but had thick batter/coating, and very little flavor. The ong choy was oily but had no flavor- couldn't taste any shrimp paste and it wasn't salty enough.

I don't know if I came on a bad night or why the food was so bad. Their prices are inexpensive, they're open really late, and the young cashier woman was nice, so I'll probably give it another chance. With ABC closed, there are not that many restaurants open later nearby.
author: Ellen H.

description: I usually like the food here, but my sister found a rubber band in the chow mein today. The portions are huge, and a take out order usually lasts me a couple meals.
author: Tiffany K.

description: The food was a bit bland and mediocre at best. The roasted bird was cut inti bits to the point where eating is difficult and lobster's flavor was not that good compared to the ones I've eaten in other places. I ordered walnut & shrimp and they gave us cashews instead. The waitress were unresponsive and would forget a lot of things you tell them.
author: Gordon L.

description:
You see a small Chinese restaurant with an unflattering furnishing and there's not much to think about after that.

-You only go during lazy Tuesday nights for take-away chicken fried rice (and you drench it in Sriracha at home).

-You only go when you're balling on a budget because $25 can get you a filling dinner for 2 with leftovers for lunch the next day.

-It's a place you NEVER suggest to a friend. You'll suggest Koi Palace or S&T. You will suggest House of Xian or House of Pancakes. But never in your life will you suggest Oriental Seafood Restaurant.

That's all fair. OSR is not heralded like their neighbor S&T, nor do they have a special dish such as the Dan Dan Mien like House of Xian. It's not, as young cats would say, "lit". But I'm here to change that. Because OSR has a lot to offer, and it can be "lit" for all of us. 

Consider creating your own happy hour at OSR with your group of friends. $4 for a bottle of Heineken or TsingTao (spoiler: they taste the same), so that's $12 for a pretty good time. Supplement the beer with an array of Chinese makeshift Happy Hour food. The Salt & Pepper Spareribs ($8) is crispy, fried, meaty, and just begging to be washed down by a bottle of cold beer. For a slightly lighter option (with an big emphasis on slightly), the Honey Walnut Shrimp is a crowd favorite. Slightly fried shrimp doused heavily in mayonnaise, this popular dish takes away all the natural flavors of the shrimp and replaces it with a gluttonous awesomeness. In other words, the ideal pairing for mass-produced beer. Then after downing anywhere from 3 to 5 beers, you can finish this perfect experience with an order The Steamed Surf Clams ($7-8 per person). The clams are served sliced on a small bed of vermicelli with a healthy amount of soy sauce, all plated on the original clam shell. It's a good finish to the meal and gives a good glimpse of what OSR has to offer other than its Panda-esque menu. 

Your group will leave Oriental Seafood Restaurant with your bellies full and a slight buzz from reasonably priced beers -- a perfect pre-game. As your group Lyft your way out to an awesome night out, keep track of the OSR's bill total as compared to your transportation cost. You may not find a more economic Happy Hour place in all of San Francisco. Isn't that worth a recommendation?

--

For people looking for serious seafood, I'd be remiss not to mention their Lobster. I'm not here to vouch for it's taste or OSR's cooking technique, I'm here to vouch for its value. 

Lobsters are always market price, but I've been able to get away with $20 to $23 a pound. For a 6lb monster, you're only looking at $140 ish. This is crazy. I repeat, crazy. For a similar lobster at Koi Palace and/or Hong Kong Flower Lounge, you're going to be ponying up $300+. 

The lobster can be served two different styles. The classic Cantonese way would be to have one plate be cooked with Ginger and Scallion. This way of cooking is supposed to minimize the interference with the Lobster's natural flavors while adding another layer of aroma. Or so my Grandpa says, he's the expert in our fam. The second way would be for it to be steamed with garlic over a bed of vermicelli. The same logic applies, minimize the interference of the Lobster's flavor.

This 6lb Lobster feeds four. Before cooking, the waitress will fish out the Lobster for your table to see how lively it is. I can attest, it's usually as lively as Blake Lively. This has become my go-to restaurant to take my gramps. He loves the giant lobster, and I'm all in on OSR's value. Good stuff.
author: Ringo M.

description:
3.5 STARS

After drinking across the street in celebration of a Warriors win, the boys were hungry. We decided to go to Oriental Seafood Restaurant on Thursday, June 8th around 12 midnight. Our party of three was seated right away at a big round table. (At least I think it was a big table. My memory is a little hazy.) Good thing cuz a girlfriend joined us a little later so there was plenty of room.

*Crab Meat with Sweet Corn Soup ($6.95)
*Oysters with Roast Pork in Clay Pot ($9.95)
*Yang Chow Fried Rice ($7.50)
*Pea Shoots (Dau Miu)

I wasn't hungry at all, so I didn't really try anything. Had a bite of the dao miao which was cooked perfectly. (I hate overcooked mushy veggies.) It also had a nice amount of garlic flavor. The rest of the food looked great and everyone seemed to enjoy it. I believe the check was around $40. Not bad for four people and we had leftovers.

Good option for late night eats if you are craving Chinese food.
author: Elena N.

description:
The food is good, had flavor, and cheap. Pretty good size portions . Service is your usual Chinese restaurant style service. It was a plus that they speak English. The place could use a good cleaning remodel. Our bill was about $50 

Salt n pepper beef rib
Dried scallop egg white fried rice
Crab n corn soup
Black bean clams
Steamed flounder with ginger soy
author: T V.

description: Chow mein, chow fun, Hong Kong Style Chow Mein are all delicious! I've been coming here since I was little. I love the corn soup! The Chinese broccoli is always good as well. The price is decent. Parking is pretty easy.
author: Jaxxxie P.

description: I really want to give them a 5 star rating, but I cant. The prices and food are great, but the customer service sucks. Food takes a long time to come out and the waitress doesn't really pay attention to the customers.
author: Peter N.

description:
I can't believe this restaurant. Used to be my boyfriend's favorite place to eat as a kid but not anymore. Firstly, they made us wait longer than we should... they immediately helped and served 2 tables that came AFTER us while we waited for the server the whole time. Secondly, there were bugs. in. our. soup. Maggots!! Straight up larvae!!! 

So you're telling me such a restaurant has the gall to serve unhygienic food to people.....but still give horrible, biased service to them?!?! It's insulting!!! Their location looks so small and dirty too....how dare they ignore us when their whole establishment is a mess!! Never will we come here again. Oriental Seafood Restaurant....GET IT TOGETHER!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I love places like these. Not fancy by any means but it's really the food that I love. Their food tastes like I'm getting food from a family home. You know it's authentic when they have a "secret" menu that you can only order if you grew up in China. 

Full disclosure, the number one thing I order here is the Salt & Pepper Pork Intestines. Yep, you heard that right. And I'm glad they serve it because I would've never known they had it unless I asked as it wasn't on their normal menu. This is now my go-to take out place when I want Chinese food. Also, service is very friendly.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Please stay away from this landfill and leave it to the pigeons and roaches!!!
Wow this place should get shut down! How much do u have to bribe food inspectors to stay open when u obviously are a health hazard?
Haven't been here for several months but came across it looking up late nite digs.  NOT SURPRISED TO SEE THIS PLACE IN TROUBLE WITH THE FOOD INSPECTORS!! In the past I admit returning food here on several occasions after I found hair in entrees, but still came back! NO NO NO MORE!!!

My fault in the past for being so hungry so late at nite but I figure if I want pubic or armpit hair in my fried rice or beef stew I should stick to my own. The warning from the health inspector just validated what my nose and eyes knew to be true.

Please stay away from this landfill and leave it to the pigeons and roaches!!!
author: Charles B.

description: This spot is pretty good. It's farther down Noriega. Serves up good Cantonese cooking. We got beef brisket and wonton noodle soup, beef and bok choy stir fried rice noodles, and oysters. Parents came back from cruise and we ate here late night around 11:30. I think we found the meal satisfying. Too bad interior is less than average.
author: Denise C.

description:
This place smells like dead mice! 

The food is edible and the lunch specials are really good value if you can tolerate the strong stench of dead mice.
author: Johnny D.

description: First let me say I'm extremely disappointed with the service and I have never walked out of a restaurant before this moment. We walked in at 7 PM were seated and order within 4 minutes and then it went downhill from there. We waited 40 minutes while others that came after us not only got their soup, but also their main dish and when we tried to ask the servers how long the food would take they glanced and walked by us. When the server finally came up she brought out a soups that we did not order and then said hold on I'll have them change it. Waited 6 more minutes and nothing. We left at this point and were very disappointed and I have never been treated this way. The food used to be good but I don't know about now. It seems maybe a management change, but I hope they take this review seriously.
author: Mike S.

description:
This is a nice clean place with friendly staff. 

The food came quickly (which was an especially good thing since another table just got their food and it looked and smelled fabulous) and was piping hot. 

Since I was dining alone (I know, "Dining alone? What's that?") I ordered the sizzling rice soup with pork. It was so very good! 

The soup had carrots, mushrooms, snap peas, pork, and, of course, the rice. Everything was just so good and fresh. The only thing missing was water chestnuts. 

It was meant to be a lite lunch bite, but I had a hard time stopping and nearly finished the whole thing. 

It's hard to judge a place by one dish, but aren't we all judgemental to some degree? So I judge this place four stars.

I guess this is a good reason to return.  I bet I'll order the soup again but I'll be sure to have reinforcements so I can try other dishes.
author: Sira V.

description:
Man, this place was such a disappointment. Food was decent, but the attitude of the servers was intolerable. We ordered 3 dishes for dinner. Two came out within 10 minutes apart, and the last one just never made it. The waitress was really rude when the other tables asked to change orders and whatnot. We didn't bother her thinking if the food came, that'd be fine, if not, make sure they don't charge us.

About a half hour later, still no third dish. We were done eating, so we asked for the check. The waitress went into the kitchen with out bill and came back out without acknowledging us. We sat there for another 10 or 15 minutes and asked the second time for the bill, the cashier said to wait. When we asked for the check again, that was when the waitress rushed out with the dish. She said she gave our food to the wrong table, no apology whatsoever. I then said i. cantonese that we've already finished eating and asked for the bill more than twice and you JUST send out this dish! She said rudely, "do you want it or not??" My bf said, "we didn't touch it, so no! I tried to tell you to cancel earlier, but you walked away without letting me finish speaking." She then stormed back to our table, picked up the dish, and stormed back into the kitchen. We waited another 10-15 minutes before we finally got our bill. They totally ignored our request for a takeout box, so we had to get it ourselves.

Stay away from this place unless you like having rude servers serving your food.
author: Karen H.

description:
My buddy invited me to this restaurant to have dinner.  I reviewed the menu and was surprised why everything was so reasonably priced ($5-8). I figured the portion will be small at that price : I was so wrong . When the food arrived , my jaws dropped as to the amount of food that was on each plate .  I was still skeptical , so I dove into each dish.  OmGeeeeeee !!!! It was like eating in Chinatown , back in the days . The food was really really really good .  The chef has some talent here 

Food review:

Peking porkchop : Just like I always imagined it . Sweet/tangy with the right amount of crispness . 

Clams with black bean sauce : tender juicy little morsels . Mixed in the sauce with rice and u r in heaven ..Yummy indeed 

Chicken Salty fish w/egg plant: not over salty. One taste brings back fond memories in ToiShan . 

Spinach w/garlic : need in say more . 

All the above was perfectly seasoned . Triple bonus for no MSG attack after the meal. 

Many thanks to the cool smiley waitress
author: Joe L.

description:
Oriental Seafood Restaurant was a LIFE SAVER this past Saturday 9/30 when we tried to go to ABC but found out that they close at 2:00 a.m. now! I was designated driver for two drunk folks and they were NOT going to be happy unless we got food ASAP.

We walked down a couple stores and saw that this place still had their "Open" neon sign on. There was nobody else in there except for a single table of two people. We asked the lone gentleman (who we later found out was the only person working in the whole place) if they were still open, and he reluctantly let us sit down. We ordered the Fukien Fried Rice, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Fried Oysters, and Ginger & Scallion Crab. We also tried to order Frog Legs based on another diner's recommendation, but they never made it to the table, either forgotten or omitted entirely. The bill came out to be about $70 and change.

While we were here, parties of 3, then 8, then 14 came in after us. The person working had tried to lock the door after we came in, but apparently failed because people just kept walking in. This is also when we found out that he was the only person working, because he disappeared to the back of the kitchen and cooked nonstop for a good 15 minutes before reappearing with a bunch of food. Most of the tables helped themselves to hot tea, napkins, utensils etc.

Overall, the food was average but tasted amazing at 2:30 in the morning. 4 stars for staying open waaaay past their closing time (we were there until about 3:15 a.m.) and being extremely accommodating despite being a one-man team at the time!
author: Munnie T.

description: Ordered pork but there is chicken inside and the whole dish is onion....don't know what to say... disgusting.
author: HE H.

description:
1.5 stars


How do you mess up the most simple Chinese dish?

Came here in San Fran after going to the 16th Street Tiles along with Polly Ann [reviews coming!]

Ordered fried beef noodle. It had a lot of oil. It tasted decent, but you could taste the MSG and the oil just slithering in your mouth, rejecting it deeply. It's bad, bad..and bad.

But you know what was even worse?

Seafood fried rice.

The WORST rice that I have ever tasted in any fried rice. It was, canto translation, "broken". It tasted choppy and did not have any flavor at all. The seafood didn't even help... I had to eat the shrimp which wasn't even that good, and the peas and carrots. You needed hot sauce. Or soy sauce. Or anything. Which shows how bad this is. I usually am fine with eating stuff that doesn't need any other sauces. But this one was that bad.

Slow service as well, it took about 20 minutes for everything to come out. Yes. You read that right. 20 minutes for the noodles and the fried rice. Guess which one came out first? The noodles. 

Would not come here again. There are better options out there in San Francisco.

The only good thing about this place? The food is cheaply priced, but after you eat it, you realize why it's so cheap. Service is below average, even for Chinese standards. They don't really do too much to help you after they bring your food. Raise your hand! (And that might not even work, because for a couple minutes, there was no one in the small restaurant- they were in the back getting the food out).

Wasn't even full- would say a third of the way full. And the restaurant is small too.
author: Raymond L.

description:
OK, this is a new low for me.  We came in and sit down, waitress came up and asked if we were ready to order, we said yes and we started ordering. As we spelled out the dishes, she just walked off in the middle, taking the menu away.  Couldn't believe it, I called to stop her to order another 2 dishes, she became very upset and irratated about it.
I have never seen such rudeness in a restaurant before.
author: Kuren O.

description: This is probably my last time to order from this restaurant.  1 star for food ready for pick up before suggested available time.  I ordered 2 dishes to go for dinner - beef spare rib with eggplant- beef has the frozen smell but the eggplant is ok; fish with tofu - fish has the same frozen smell but the tofu is ok.  I will not recommend this test to anyone unless you don't have any taste buds & just for cheap food.
author: Leslie C.

description: Place is cheap but good. Honey walnut prawns are a go to favorite of mine. Make sure you go there with a someone who knows how to order though.
author: Joe P.

description: Decent restaurant for you late night seafood lovers. Been going here since a kid. Decent prices/decent food
author: Eddie C.

description:
No Frillz Chinese food. 

Came here with a few friends at 12:30am, service was good and the food was OK. We ordered the Shrimp and Walnuts, salt and pepper spare ribs, oysters in plum sauce, and pork chow mein. Nothing really stood out flavor wise, but it was passable. Greasy for sure, but for what you pay, I wasn't surprised 

Most dishes range from $4-10, so if you are on a budget, this place will suffix. 

Cheap prices and open late makes this place a decent stop if you are craving Chinese food Late night.
author: Paolo B.

description: Extra rude for no reason.  Been coming here for 10 years and tonight the owner decided to be a total dick.
author: User N.

description: This place has the WORST service I have ever experinced in my life. I tell them there are issues with my order and the woman literally loses her cool and basically yells at me and begins to curse me in mandarin (which she didn't know I understood) their food is crap, and if it wasn't I would have let their shitty service slide. However, the food is bland and the portions excessive. In short I highly recommend people skip this place unless you want your server to insult you after giving awful service.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I only come here for one thing: the steamed fish. And that would entail either sea bass or some other more expensive kind of fish. No catfish for me, thanks.

And for the price of said fish, it will cost me as much as a prime rib dinner. For fish. Nothing else.

I like the parsley and the green onions and soy that come with the fish, but once again, that's all I come here for.

Just me. And my fish.
author: Jack R.

description:
Used to frequent this place with my family for cheap decent Chinese food. Just don't order the watercress jook. They don't wash the watercress properly, filled with flies and little gnats. Unless you're looking for that extra protein :|

But what I really came here to say is one night, my mother and I walked in the front door, and then a RAT came scurrying from behind their front cashier's desk, between my mom's feet, and straight back into the restaurant. Needless to say, never again. With a health score of 90, you've seriously got to wonder how much of that is true when they've got rats running around.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Apparently, you could come here with the crabs you caught, and they will cook it for you but for some reason, the waiter refused to and said that the crabs caught by people in my party said it was too small. We kept telling him that it was legal because we had a ruler and we would have obviously been fined if we took crabs that were too small.

Someone from our party said that they called before and the person on the phone said it was fine and that they will cook it so I don't know why he wasn't letting us...
author: Aj C.

description:
Came here today after not eaten here for 1-2 years. Wow, things have gone down hill.. 
It used to be decent. When I went in today, the old owner and employees were not there anymore and it a lot of new faces. 

The restaurant was empty at dinner prime time, 7pm. I should have took a clue and left.

I ordered my usual, beef stew over rice and it came out to $9. That's fine but it used to be $6 so the price hike is high. 

My rice plate was the one of the worst I have ever seen... It's like the chef literally tried to sabotage the restaurant. I got literally ALL pieces of fats and 2 pieces of meat. I am not exaggerating. At this point, I am just grateful that I didn't get food poisoning. I saw the Yelp's food safety warning AFTER I ate the food! lol. Lesson learned. 

What a difference a year or so does to a business. I hope this once great restaurant will rise again to serve the people of Sunset. Until then, I am staying far away. 
I would have brought it back but I was already home when I opened the box. Plus, I doubt they would give me a refund. 

It's a pity because this used to be a a decent place with a big clientele base.

Just stay away from here...
author: U L.

description:
Came here by random since they weren't busy and since most places seemed to close before 10pm. We chose a Family menu (4-6 people) set for $58 bucks (price for ~$40ish crossed out). Dishes came out quick, and were all edible (nothing amazing or anything), except for one. The seafood veggie dish that we got from the set menu had rotten bok choy in it with yellowish squid! I've gotten this dish at many other restaurants, I know how it's suppose to look. The bok choy had no crunch and felt airy to taste and also tasted empty, if you guys get that.  We told one server when she came to clear the plate, and another one when she dropped off the bill. They ignored and even pretended that they didn't hear us complaining. 
When it comes down to it, we were still charged for everything, no courtesy apologies or a percentage off the bill. A simple apology... or actually ANY reaction that would help out their customer service would have been nice. I won't be visiting this establishment again, also i hope you guys enjoy your tip on the full amount of the meal after taxes, because you guys surely didn't deserve it.
author: Lily S.

description: We came here for dinner tonight after UCSF & while this place lacks in flash, it makes up for the good food it serves.  We were not disappointed by the friendly service & low prices.  The orange peal chicken has a good orange flavor, but lacks iun spiciness though ther are chili peppers in the dish; our fault for ordering a Szechwan dish at a Cantonese restaurant.  The salt & pepper prawns are a hit with suculent prawns with a lite badder & wonderful salt & pepper mixture; I love the jalapinos & how they add to the bit of kick with the dish.  The e fu noodles with crab meat are lite & buttery with fresh crab meat, meaty mushrooms, & onions.  My mother loved her shrimp fried rice & has enough left for a couple days.  Needless to say, I have lunch tomorrow.  The tea is wonderful; definitely warms you up on a cold San Francisco night.  I loved the juicy oranges we got at the end of our meal.  So, for excellent Cantonese cuisine at low prices w2ith friendly service in a bare bones atmosphere, Oriental Seafood Restaurant cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: After several days of being sick and having bad appetite,the dishes here made us feel really excited!!!
author: Juliet P.

description:
First time eating this restaurant. The food is normal not that good because most of the food they have is simple and easy to make at home. 
The price is cheap.
I have less chance to come back to this restaurant.
author: Kaung N.

description: Terrible customer service I ordered a clay pot and they brought out rice with it.  Then after I ate it I was told it was not included and it's 5.00 extra. No ice for the ice water food stunk to bad !!!
author: James R.

description:
Not the best tasting Chinese restaurant ever, but for the price and portion size, it is unbeatable. Where else can you get a big portion of food for under $6? 

Avoid anything that has to do with fried rice because its usually quite plain. Any of the dishes are solid though. Dry beef chow fun is good too.
author: Wilson P.

description:
The place is dirty and smells the moment one walks in the door. The tables are sticky and the utensils have things stuck to them. The waiters are rude and are there to do what they are paid for.

The food is poorly made but the prices aren't that bad compared the places around them.
author: M C.

description:
Dating in general cracks me up.

After a short period of time dating a bunch of dysfunctional mentally-afflicted psycho babies with virtual stalking habits, I finally threw in my gloves usually reserved for therapy slap-sessions and agreed to meet up with someone who had been persistent with communication and seemingly much more of an adult than the aforementioned.  

Oriental Seafood Restaurant is a misnomer, to say the very least.  Do not let the plain and rather fading green awning fool you.  Or the carnival-induced namesake deter you (the term, "oriental" being applied to all Asians is usually a sign he was way too old to date, as was the case w/one geriatric).  The minute you step over the threshold, affable and cheery countenances greet you almost immediately.  This is a typical SF establishment set in the outer Sunset so expectations of fancy linings or the trappings of touristy clout will not woo you.  The carpeted flooring is ancient as are the blurry mirrors on the wall and the chairs, despite being comfortable after a long walk out on the beach, sport cracked vinyl.  This is where the locals and neighbors go for consistently large portions of greasy yet delicious American Chinese food (or traditional Chinese, if you can read/speak the language and order off the menu as thus).  Hot tea is always followed by a small ceramic dish filled with these savory coated peanuts that they also sell for $4 by the takeout box.  I nibble on these whilst perusing the menu.  Skip the typical fortune cookie dessert and request the hot red bean porridge instead.  The mildly sweet dessert will settle a full stomach.

This is by far, the most inexpensive joint (most of the dishes run around $5.95) I have found and the portions never reflect the cheap prices.  We have never been wronged by ordering the following: House Chow Mein, Pork Chow Fun, Wor Won Ton soup, Hot and Sour Soup, Mongolian Beef, Sweet & Sour Pork, Moo Shu Pork, Gai Lan w/garlic sauce, Steamed chicken w/garlic oil, fried (and steamed) flounder, shrimp + sauteed greens, Peking spareribs, and Black Bean Short Ribs. I've grown up with this menu so do not judge:  I am not Chinese and was born in America, which would reflect the rather typical order.  However, that being said, the plates consistently come heaping with food and we always leave with leftovers boxed neatly stacked and bagged.

My previous dates have enjoyed this spot.  My friends have enjoyed this spot.  And when family visits, I take them to this spot.  Parking is plentiful a few blocks down so park the car at a meter or take Muni and walk a bit.  Leave the chubby butts and lazy countenances back in suburbia.  And in retrospect, I will never take dates here again because this has become my little to-go-spot after running w/my friends and their dogs at Ocean Beach and Fort Funston.

Consistency, maturity and longevity, I salute you.
author: Miika M.

description:
Hole in the wall at it's best! This place deserves 5 stars for what it is.

No, the service is not top notch, the restaurant isn't the best looking, and the food is not spectacular either BUT for the amount you pay here, it doesn't get better than this. 

The food is great. Everything was packed with flavor down to the bok choy which is boring often times. The service is good. We never had to ask for refills on anything thing -- tea, napkins, rice. Even when the restaurant was full, they still checked on us often. They even changed our plates in the middle of our meal.

They have set dinners at unbelievable prices. What we had was the $46 set. It came with:
-Westlake beef soup
-Sweet and sour pork chops (we sub'd salt and pepper pork chops)
-Lobster w/ginger and scallions
-Calamari with bok choy
-Clams with black bean sauce
-Steam shrimp (we sub'd salt and pepper shrimp)

Portions are huge. There were 4 of us and we had leftovers to take home. This meal would have fed another person easily. At the end they even give you a dessert soup. 

For about $13 bucks a person, I really didn't expect this level of service and that we'd be having lobster, clams and shrimp. It doesn't get better than this.
author: Andy W.

description:
Love this restaurant.

Their Peking Pork Chop is absolutely delicious.  It's one of our family favorites now!
author: David W.

description: Chinese food, how can you go wrong? Ah, but you can at this place. The food was oily and bland. Customer service was terrible. And they don't take pennies so the round up on the prices. I'm sorry but if I'm going to pay for my food, I'm going to pay for what it actually cost. Not your imaginative phobia of having pennies in your drawer. You not only cheated on the food but you also cheated on the prices. Cheap or not, don't round up!!
author: D G.

description:
Found them on Yelp and decided to give them a try. I have to give them props for my take out order has enough food for 3. I am enjoying the shrimp fried rice and the salt and pepper pork is really good. Little confusing trying to make sure the lady taking my order understood I did not want spicy. But made it passed.

The food is good. My only negative is the restrooms could use a little cleaning. 

If you have the time stop through and try their food.
author: Terrance J.

description: This place is really like a hole in the wall but it's worth going to! It's tasty real Chinese food unlike Panda Express. Be patient because there may only be one waitress and there's another guy I'm guessing the owner who comes out takes orders and cooks too. I suggest bringing a friend who speaks Chinese just to make life a little easier when you're hungry but it's not a must. Enjoy and be prepared to bring home left overs.
author: Laylay B.

description:
Delicious food, inexpensive pricing, and generous portions! They also give you free soup and hot tea as well. 

I really like the Oyster dish that is served on a sizzling iron skillet, over a bed of onions and ginger. I am also a fan of the mixed-seafood dish, served on crispy noodles and the same dish served on chow fun. Another favorite is a curry chicken with onions and bell peppers, the chicken is nice and tender, with a generous portion of the veggies.

The service has also improved (more friendly) than the last time i ate here, which was about a year ago..the main reason I hadn't been there in a year.
author: Jim L.

description:
They open until around 2 or 3am.

Overall pros:
-Inexpensive
-Huge servings
-Quick service

The downfalls? The typical grittiness of the place, and the somewhat sticky utensils/chairs.

Still...
One of the best places to order geoduck - for those of you who don't know what geoduck is, it looks like this: http://wdfw.wa.gov/fishing/shellfish/geoduck/graphics/2geoduck.jpg
and as nasty as that may look, the taste and texture is between a clam and a scallop. They have several dishes of geoduck you can order from, and this is one of the few Chinese restaurants that get it right.
The lobster with ginger and scallions is also pretty well cooked, though slightly too oily...but hey, Chinese place here. What ISN'T oily?

Nothing's too salty, too peppery, too...anything (but occasionally oily).
author: Colleen M.

description:
This is truly a hole-in-the-wall restaurant that is easily overlooked because it's situated right next to ABC.

On my first visit here with my boyfriend, we ordered the salt and pepper short ribs to-go. When our order was ready, which took no longer than 15 minutes, I was surprised. The meat was jammed into a plastic container box, to the point where the box almost didn't close shut! It's more than enough for two people to finish in one sitting. At about $6-7/entree for most dishes here, the prices cannot be beat. 

On my second visit here with a friend of mine, we ordered the hot crispy (half) chicken and flat rice noodles with beef and bok choy. I'm not lying when I say that their hot crispy chicken is comparable to San Tung's chicken wings. The sauce is sweet and spicy and the skin on top of the chicken is perfectly crispy. More so, I feel a little bit better (health-conscious wise) eating the crispy chicken since it's mostly white meat. And the total cost of our meal which we both completely devoured up and had no leftovers whatsoever? $14 with tax and tip.

Will I be back? Definitely. Extra pluses: free peanuts as appetizer, friendly service, open until 2am, and accepts VISA and Mastercard. Give this place a try!
author: Annie S.

description:
Came here for dinner with babe and his family and I was not impressed at all with this place.

Everything either tasted bad or very mediocre, with the exception of their clams with xo sauce and their fish soup.

Fried rice was completely bland, might as well have ordered a plain white rice.

Duck tongue - was not my cup of tea, smelled a little like stinky tofu to me for some reason 

Big clam with vermicelli - umm weird noodles and weir meat. 

$76 fish (didnt know what we had) - 1/2 split up to make a soup and that was pretty good actually and the other 1/2 was steamed and served with a nice soy sauce.  I liked the soy sauce a lot, but the fish was sliiiiggghhtly over cooked.

I don't remember the other dishes but they were all up along that alley. 

My stomach feels kind of upset right now, and you bet ill be going to eggettes for milk tea and some original eggettes to fill me up because I didn't feel like eating that much here. 

Oh and we saw a tank if dead cat fishes.... So beware. 

You will not be seeing me here again.
author: Harriet W.

description: They made us tip for lousy service. They were very rude and when we refused to tip, the serve told us to leave.
author: Francis D.

description:
Disappointing and dishonest.

We ordered a fish entree and was told there was only one fish left. They brought the live fish for us to inspect and approve. Tell me how the last fish that should have been on our dinner table was somehow still in the tank while we were eating it? Kind of hard to do a bait and switch if you have a tank right there...

Otherwise, the food was decent (at best). Major minus points for the dishonesty though, because it makes me wonder about the cleanliness behind the scenes...
author: Tammy H.

description: like Three Star, this place is right up the street from my old church, so we routinely ordered food there quite often for our meetings. we usually order their ribs, beef chow fun, fried rice (which i only know the chinese name of), and then a vegetable dish, and it's always consistently good. and whenever we have gone there to eat-in, their service has been great for us, so no major complaints here. it can get busy and parking in the area is bad of course, but we were regulars so it helps.
author: Mike C.

description:
Food was not good at all and I'm surprised they're still open. 

The old chinese waitress in her 50s was extremely rude. She rushed us in ordering and did not help us out much. The bill came out to $51 and we only decided to leave a $2 because the service was not good. The waitress was rude enough to say, "Oh sorry. Minimum tip is $6 for service." She basically made us tip her and TIP AMOUNT IS OPTIONAL. As if that wasn't enough, she gossiped as we left and I quote, "These people are so cheap. They gave $2 for a $60 meal." 

Your service was horrible. If you had great service, we would have initially left you a good tip. Obviously, it wasn't the case. I'm never ever coming back and I'm telling everyone I know to never support your business ever. The owner really needs to hire well-mannered employees because it's driving customers away.
author: Terri H.

description:
Good portions of usually tasty food at cheap prices.

However, if ordering take out be sure and check that your orders are correct!  The woman who answers the phone cannot understand English and has given us the incorrect orders as well as not placing an order at all.
author: Luisa T.

description:
First off, I have never ordered seafood here. So I actually don't know how it tastes. But don't get fooled by the name. Really... It's not as pricey as it sounds. 

With that said, I got a beef chow fun with gravy. This is one of their best dishes!!!  Huge portions!!! No lie! I always leave with lunch the next day. 

 However, they did raise the price nearly $1. It used to be $4.65. Now it's $5.50 something. Which is why I knocked them a star. Still good but I feel cheated paying 20%ish more. 

Tip: don't go to the bathroom. And don't check how the food is made in the back. Some things are best left unseen.
author: Christopher S.

description:
I remember coming here years ago with my family and having to stand around waiting for a table to open up.  They offered us blistered peanuts upon being seated and sure enough they still do now.

Fast forward many many years, I still remember this restaurant as the, "peanut" one.  I suggested coming here this past Friday and was surprised to see it just half full.  There were 5 of us and we were seated at a large table but crammed into the corner which made it hard to utilize the space.

For some reason, us Asians *need* to start a meal with soup.  But, since we didn't order any, to save room for real food, they gave us a complimentary bowl.  It wasn't anything special; it was just some veggie and meat in broth.  But nice nonetheless.  

Along with the soup, we got a:
Beef and mushroom dish: its listed on the specials board which you wouldn't have known about if you can't read Chinese characters.  This dish was amazing and I'm sad to not know the name of it. 
BBQ pork fried rice:  yummy, decent, nothing bad to say
Seafood HK fried noodles:  love crunchy noodles!
Green beans:  beans seemed a little over cooked
Sauteed eggplant:  another great dish with perfectly cooked eggplant

Aside from the lack of ambiance we had a pretty awesome meal.  Everything came to $40!  It's close by home and I think this is our new go-to Chinese restaurant!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
We ate there TWICE today. Once around 3:45 for takeout and 8PM for dinner.

At 3:45PM, my dad was hungry and didn't want to wait for dinner so we got beef noodles & rice with bok choy & fish. Noodles were a bit greasy but came with lots of beef so it was good. 

We called in to get reservations (I don't know if you can call it a reservation) around 7:40PM for dinner at 8PM, we got it. The place was almost full when we went in. 2 tables were empty, one was ours.

It's usually pretty good, but today it was just ehh.

8 people and we were stuffed with 3 boxes full of leftovers. We had 8 or 10 things...soup, lobster, mayo shrimp with walnuts, cow stomach?, choy, bitter melon with spare ribs, fish with foo jook, sweet & sour fried pork, chicken with green onions & ginger, & dessert we had papaya with snow ear sugar water thing...I might be leaving something out, just don't remember what.

Eating in:
My dad tells me that they always have complimentary soup. Rice isn't always free, it's free during lunch but not for dinner.

For dinner it was about $120 including tax & tip, not bad for 8 people.
author: Kylie L.

description: Came here with my wife and got three awful dishes.  First was the oyster with roast pork.  There were no roast pork which I promptly informed the waitress.  She took the dish inside the kitchen.  Big mistake, heard yelling by the cook.  What came out was the same dish with added stale Bbq pork.  Only 5 tiny slices.  They were so stale and sour that we spitted them out immediately after tasting them.  Second dish was the steam chicken with ginger and scallion.  The dish was just too dry cause the chicken was pre cooked and over done.  The third dish was the beef with Chinese broccoli.  The beef was definitely bad like it was not properly refrigerated, while the broccoli was not crisp since it was just old.  There is very little traffic at this restaurant so the inventory get old and stale.  A good cook would have kept an eye on this but obviously this cook at this restaurant don' t give a damn.  Warning, don't eat here, or you will regret it.
author: Jesse C.

description:
little flies, maybe fruit flies flying around the entire time i was eating. I probably ate one.

food was not that great.
author: Erica L.

description: Place was terrible wouldn't go again if you payed me. Reason why it's so cheap because it's disgusting. Wonton soup was so disappointing no flavor and cold
author: Hayden R.

description:
Poor service. 
Kung pao was ok but crispy chicken mediocre. 
Soup also was not so great, really poor and rude service.
author: J S.

description:
Got takeout.  The food here is not good anymore, but they still give good portions and are inexpensive.  The restaurant must have new ownership.  

    1)  Beef Chow Fun with Gravy $5.25 - no taste, not enough gravy and the rice noodles were soggy.

    2)  Salted Fish & Chicken Fried Rice $5.50 - A little flavor but without the salted fish, there'll be no flavor. 

    3)  Chicken Fried Rice $5.25 - No flavor.

    4)  Flounder Fish Fillet with Tender Greens on Rice $5.50 - No flavor

    5)  Peking Spareribs on Rice ? Price - Dish not on the menu. - Pretty good taste. 
 
    6)  Singapore Fried Rice Noodles $5.50 - Has good flavor.  

    7)  Beef with Tender Green Chow Mein $5.25 - Ok flavor. 

I was so disappointed with the food.  Wished that it tasted better.  

The lady who took the orders over the phone was rude.   When I paid for the food, she didn't say thank you or even look at me. 

I don't recommend this restaurant unless you want cheap inexpensive food and don't care about the taste of the food or the service.
author: J W.

description: Although their food isn't super gourmet, they have an extremely vast selection. Prices are also super cheap! Would definitely recommend if your looking for some cheap and authentic Chinese food. And their open till 1:30AM for those late night munchies. I love the Fujian Chow Fun ($6.60).
author: Allen K.

description: First off... I've been coming here for many years. I've lived in the outer sunset my whole life, less than a mile from them. Since then, I've only had minor complaints, but today, I ordered my usual (salt and pepper fried fish) over rice. I barely got any fish, so I called and complained because it's not even close to what I'm used to getting. They said they wouldn't do anything and that's just how much fish you get. I ordered another order and went to pick it up. They didn't give a flying f*ck that I went back. He charged me the full amount and said what I ordered was charged correctly (in his Asian accent of course. Keep in mind that I'm half Chinese and speak fluently so don't call me racist). I'm tired of people taking advantage of others. I really liked this place and stood up to the name even when my fiends told me their bad experiences with them. Now I see the true colors of this establishment. The owner will act nice but when it comes down to it, he's not nice at all. Thanks for being rude and inconsiderate. You don't need my business anymore.
author: Nick K.

description:
What's there to say?  The menu is made up of largely the same types of dishes you would find at just about every other Chinese restaurant in the Sunset/Richmond.  However, the food here is not only good, but cheap!  My favorite so far has been their Rock Cod and Tofu clay pot dish, and there was plenty of tastiness to be had with their portion size.  Just writing about it right now makes me want to head out and get some for dinner tonight!

Been here a handful of times and it's usually been for dinner on a weeknight, so I can't really comment on how the crowds are on weekends.  Each time I've been though, there hasn't been any sort of wait, so it's a pretty safe bet during the week.  

One nice little thing that they do for those times that you do dine in is that they give you two small plates of roasted peanuts and pickled radish to start with.  It's definitely a small thing, but most places don't seem to do it, and it's always nice to get free food!  I'm still not sure that it's quite at the level of China First for cheap Chinese, but certainly one of the best you can find here in the Sunset.
author: Mike L.

description:
If you are looking for a "meal deal", this is the place.  It is a nice hole-in-the-wall establishment.  The prices are unbelievably inexpensive for what you get, particularly the lunch menu.....you get soup, entree, and tea for about $6!  The dinner menu is typical of Chinese restaurants, but very gentle on your wallet.  On our recent visit on a Friday evening, the waitress was very accommondating in fulfilling variations from their usual offerings on the printed menu. The following dishes arrived promptly and piping hot:

Chicken chow-fun (in lieu of the traditional beef):  The meat was tender and moist.
Egg plant hot pot:  Very well prepared, accompanied by flavorful grounded pork.
Salt/pepper spareribs:  Plenty of meaty pork chops coated with a thin crust.  There was definitely a presence of jalapeño on the plate, but the "kick" didn't transfer into the meat.
Fried flounder:  Very crispy with favorful soy sauce.  Its impossible for me to make this dish for $7.50.
Complimentary soup of the day:  It was simple root vegetable with pork bone...very well done!  Taste just like homemade (by mom).
Service:  The dining room was about 80% full with only two ladies working when we were there.  They were courteous, prompt with taking our order, and responsive when we were ready for the check.
Parking:  I've been here for lunch and dinner on various days of the week.  I've always been able to find street parking within a block or two.

For the price, this is a go-to place for casual dining and a real bargain.
author: Jean T.

description:
I have always ordered out here and never eaten in.  The food here has 3 qualities: gluttonous portions, the cheap prices, and "wok hay" (flavor a hot seasoned wok gives).

No it's nothing fancy, but it's likely one of the most solid bang for the buck chinese food places.  Ordered 6 dishes for about $35 for 4 people with enough leftovers for another dinner.  To give you an idea of the portions, for items like noodles or fried rice, the take out box is packed full!  It's also great that their food isn't salty.
author: Christopher L.

description: I went to this restaurant few times. the food is ok but the kitchen are dirty and the bathroom super stinky. the waitress are very unfriendly. would go there anymore.
author: Rock D.

description:
Great hole-in the wall neighborhood restaurant that my in-laws always go to.  Prices are cheap, portions are big.  yes the service is not great but if that's what you get in a Chinese hold-in-the wall for the price you paid.

They serve you soup, peanuts, and cabbages as soon as you come in, I love the soup, and have complementary dessert.  I'd rather have these than more smiles
author: Lusi F.

description:
When my bf and I came in, we were pointed where to sit. The waitress came, tossed the menu on the table, and walked away. We didn't mind because we knew how typical the service at places like these were. 

I think everything on the menu has MSG.
But we still ordered:
Clams w/ Black Bean Sauce= Probably the best thing we ate here.
Garlic-Salt Fried Crab= Extra salty, the crab meat was decent.
Fried Chicken= Dried and old, but it came with those puffy chips.

My boyfriend went to pay and they demanded we tip them an extra dollar. WHAT?!
author: Binh H.

description:
We've been eating here for the last 2 years.  The prices, portions and service are fantastic; the waitress remembers us, to the point where she remembers the dishes we normally order. 

The food is a bit inconsistent.  There are two main chefs.  The day chef cooks quite bland and the food is dull.  The wok aroma just isn't there.  The night chef has some AMAZING cooking and usually arrives to work around 530-6pm.  

For example, we ordered a beef fried rice and a chicken fried rice at the same time.  The beef fried rice was delicious, while the chicken fried rice was bland.  It was so obvious that we could tell it was two different people cooking back there.

The crispy fried chicken is excellent, but everything else depends on the cook.
author: Tiffany A.

description: I come here pretty often to get things like lemon chicken, sweet and sour pork and chicken. Only A-ok because I am not a fan, but my dad is. Gotta please the pops =)
author: Teresa C.

description:
Here's another inexpensive Chinese food place that puts out a lot of food for the price.  This is a great place for take-out food and I've also eaten inside.  For the food, I can tell if the cooks are good:  order black bean sauce, rock cod, chow fun, dry cooked.  FANTASTIC!  Tasty, hot, and plenty.  Other dishes are also very good.  Haven't had the full dinner there yet but I'll post it when we go there.  

There are so many good Chinese restaurants around and this is a good one.  BUT PLEASE, DON'T LOOK TOO CLOSE TO THE CLEANLINESS.  They may need to have a good cleaning after they get dinged by the Health Department!
author: Stefan L.

description: Father's Day lunch with friend and fussy daughter and grandson.  Calamari, potstickers, sweetnsour chicken, barbecued pork chow mein, seafood chow fun, and pork with eggplant.  Tasty food, generous portions, , pleasant waitress, less than $50.00. Would go again soon.
author: Mary O.

description:
The food is mediocre, really nothing to rave home about.
 
i ordered the calamari appetizer which arrived cold and over cooked. My friend ordered the Peking Pork which looked and was described as bring drenched in overly sweet ketchup sauce.

The real downer was the service and overall restaurant cleanliness . Only six customers in the entire restaurant and the two waitresses (one middle aged and the other one in her early twenties) were slower than molasses in winter. The condiment containers on the table were encased on old grease and dust. The restaurant carpet smelled like an old folks home and probably wasn't cleaned or changed since the restaurant opened. 

I will never go here again.
author: Sana N.

description: For what it's worth, this place is REALLY cheap and the food is decent. However, I will never ever go here again unless my life depended on it. The last time i was here, my friends were just sitting at the table chatting when one of them goes 'I see a rat' in a very calm and nonchalant tone. I thought it was just a joke until i looked over into the doorway into the kitchen and there he was. The Chinese Remy just chilling under the hot water dispenser eating what looked like some bread. I was in utter shock. How they got an 87 for cleanliness is beyond me. The bathrooms were disgusting and the floors were dirty.
author: edward k.

description: The place is kinda good for big party .. It has 2 big table and they have live seafood, also they open late, hard to find some seafood restaurant at mid night. This time I order clam and fish, the clam was really good, but the fish is kinda over cook and it cost almost $60 for the fish, anyways other thing else in this restaurant is cheap, I think I will only come by at the late night :-)
author: joe c.

description:
wow 5 stars! you ask why I give it 5 instead of 4? Well because I love this place and I want others to come and support this place. 

I can't remember the last time i actually sat down in here and ate in since usually I order to go. This place is really convenient if you like to purchase a late dinner and you're too lazy or too busy to cook. This place stays open until 1-2am! You know what the best part is, the prices remain the same! Not only that but they have a special "late dinner" for $5.95 that includes fried rice+another entree. Thats like 80's prices for chinese restaurants. it doesn't get any better then this. 

The food is decent and I'm not going to lie and claim its the best. However the best thing about this place is definitely the price and not only that they give you mega large portions! Every time they always overdue it with the rice and vegetables. My to go boxes are always filled to the ceiling barely able to contain the contents of the food. 

If you want the best chinese food then go to a classier chiense restaurant and pay triple the price for a similar entree. If you want decently tasting and fresh chinese food for dirt cheap, this is your place.
author: Jude N.

description:
We come here at least once every two weeks for take-out.  Prices and food "can't be beat!"  

This time we decided to dine in and the food/service was terrific!!!  However towards the end when the waitress was clearing our table (at this point, we had already paid and placed the tip on the table) she whispered for more tip money, "$1.00 more will be 10%."  

Our total bill was approximately $65.00, which included the tax -- we gave her $6.00--which in our opinion was the right amount--considering that this was not a high-end Chinese restaurant.  It was your typical "hole-in-wall", semi-clean atmosphere.  On top of that, we are REGULAR customers!!!  We thought that was really tacky on her part to even ask for more tip!!!  They're lucky that we are even giving them business and TIP should always be optional per the customer's discretion.  After leaving, we still couldn't believe that even happened.

So, if you decide to tip, do it when they're not looking and leave quickly...LOL  Otherwise, the food and prices are great!!!
author: Athena C.

description:
The sister restaurant of Emperor Palace (on Balboa).  This is also one of my father's faves.  Food is ok (again, not very memorable but for the price and portions, you can't beat it).

You can order a fish off the tank.  They usually bring it out and show you (and you can see that poor fish squirming from the net as the waiter tells you how many lbs, how much yada yada). 

Restaurant space is a bit tight.  More like squeezing as many tables as you can in a space.
author: Wendy H.

description:
This review is just based on my one visit on Tuesday night earlier this week where I ordered a beef chow fun and a soup.  I haven't tried their family-style dishes to see what they're like yet (especially not their seafood, since this is a seafood restaurant according to their name).  The chow fun was okay but it was a very large portion, one that I was unable to finish.

I found that they opened until 2am, therefore it's an alternative to neighboring ABC restaurant for late night dining.  I suspected they opened late but finally confirmed it that evening.

The service was not bad.  Actually I liked that young lady who was in work uniform walking around the floor that evening. =)
author: H K.

description:
I have been coming here for years and not much has changed. The portions remain huge and their prices are still cheap.  Yes this is a typical hole in the wall Chinese Restaurant where you come in for the food and not the ambiance.  The dining area is average, at best. But, the minute the food arrives, it is all about the food.  My favoite top three dishes are the fried flounder, salt pepper pork, the beef chow fun. 
Street parking does get a bit tougher later in the eveing.  
Here's the key to a good Chinese Restaurnat hole inthe wall:  if you see a bunch of Chinese Construction contractors/workers having lunch; then you know you are in a good place.  Yummy.
author: Nathan N.

description:
It is a Chinese restaurant, so expect the table to be slightly sticky and waitresses not giving the same attention as an American restaurant. It's quick wipe and what you want to eat? 
I do come here quite often and If you're a regular you might get a smile, hello and goodbye!
Free house soup comes with lunch except for noodle soup orders.
For dinner, go early, it can be busy after 6:00 p.m. 
They do have a Chinese set price menu and banquet menu.
Chinese construction workers eat there for lunch. Must be the free soup, haha!
Mongolian beef used to be better and tomato beef chow mein is a don't order. 
Dishes like mustard green and salt and pepper pork is plentiful.
author: Stanley Y.

description: Prices are cheap and I accepted it as a balance for their mediocre food and service, but I did not expect human hair in my fried rice.
author: Chris N.

description: I want to have a party catered by this place because it'll be the most elegantly cheaperest casual dinner party of all time. And I'll do it by ordering take out that'll be made so hastily that it'll be prepared before I click "End Call" on my phone. Not every dish will be consistent in flavor and I might need to make the chef walk across the street in his oft-stylish Hunter boot knock-offs and meat market neoprene apron to the local fish market a block away to buy what they've run out of stock, but heck, I'll use the extra dough I've saved to purchase linens and dining candles for my tables that the restaurant doesn't have.
author: Derek S.

description:
This restaurant is a saving grace to me and my friends!  

I can't count the endless times I've been here late late night grabbing a bite to eat to cure those hangover!! Food is great, generous portions, and not to mention the cheap price. Although I would pay double if I had to since you normally wouldn't be able to find anything past 2, but this place stays open until the wee hours! 

Love it and would come back anytime after a night out with the girls.
author: Amy L.

description: Great food. Fast. Good. & great service. I love the lady that's always there. I think she's the owner she is so sweet I always tip even though I order take out!!!
author: Michele T.

description: This food is nasty I went to the bathroom and i see cacaroaches and it stinks like shit. the kitchen is dirty and not organize. We're ever is cacaroaches there's rats I didn't not see that but still. I don't care if it's cheap there's other places that food is cheap but damn good like good food plus clean bathrooms, kitchen, customer service. I know this things cause I cook myself. I did not want to rate 1 star but I have to so I could write this. They need to call restaurant impossible. This stuff is mediocre it looks like they loosing business and wants to make of this mediocre. The owner is going to loose his spot if he doesn't do anything about it. The little money he has left he should remodeled the whole thing staff needs training and the business will be boomin staff would get good tips without asking, and get good chunky pay checks.If he does not do this someone could get sick bring FDA sued lawsuit or something. This goes the same any restaurant like this
author: Juan Carlos G.

description:
All I have to say is this...

-Open till 3am 
-Food is better and cheaper than ABC Bakery on the same block
-Ordered Broccoli Beef Chow Mein for $4.65....UNDER $5...
-They have a lot of other options at the same price

Minus one star because it's not the cleanest looking place...but that's it.
author: Allan M.

description: I know it is Father's Day but having to wait over an hour for takeout is ridiculous. Called in takeout order at 5:45 PM and was quoted 30 minutes. It is now ten past 7 and I am still waiting. Restaurant is barely half full with dine in customers. I am witnessing smaller takeout orders getting filled faster than larger ones regardless of who ordered first. Probably just faster to eat here. Things have gone down hill here.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
We ate in a few weeks ago. Place is hella dirty. Chair and tables both sticky.  Fish looked non-responsive in the fish tank  -___- . Food scraps all over the floor, in fact some of the chairs had food scraps too. Gross. I know, I'm picky, but hey this was one of BF's old faves and I said I'll give it a try... for the second time. 

Food sucked. Sure we had a lot in quantity but quality was ew. How can you screw up a simple dish like fried rice? seriously. I'm sure the quality used to be better, according to the BF, but I'm just not so sure of it anymore.  I vow never to walk in here again. Yes it was that bad.

What's that quote? 
Fool me once, shame on you (refer back to my first review regarding the clothes pin). Fool me twice, shame on me--actually in this case, I blame the BF.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Decent food and portions but I think they pulled a bait and switch on us. We ordered the 78 dollar family course that includes crab. When we tried to order it they told us that they were out of crab but had lobster... for 20 bucks a pound. We winded up getting two small lobsters which winded up kicking the bill to 130 or so before tip when all we wanted was the 78 dollar course. 

The fishy thing was that the chef came out with a crab later on to show to another table, even though they said they were out of it just an hour ago! When we asked them why we didn't get crab they said it wasn't on the course menu. The next time anyone goes, lemme know if the crab is on the 78 course meal.
author: Theo T.

description: Family and I liked their chow mein and fried rice the few times we got dinner take-out. So I was left feeling less than impressed when we dined in and found the food overall a bit bland. Their house soup and red bean soup dessert was also watery. We ordered beef w/ tender greens, tomato beef chow mein, salt & pepper spare ribs and braised tofu w/ scallops & shrimp on a sizzling plate. Portion sizes were good but, again, the flavor and taste were nothing to rave about. My only pet peeve among all the dishes is that the most of the spare ribs were extremely fatty and didn't have actual meat.
author: Cliff W.

description: oh how the mighty have fallen! i had three dishes to go. all rice plates all terrible beyond belief. beef and bean cake over rice. with four slices of beef. mongolian beef over rice with over half of the beef inedible because of the fat and gristle. and fish filet with bok choy. the fishy wreaked and the bok choy was dirty. WTH, i used to like eating at this greasy smelly dive. Nevermore!
author: Jeff W.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Chinese food but was coerced into dining here by loving, well-meaning, in-laws.

Though I am teh Azn, I have been criticized by many for having a deeper appreciation for "white-people" food.  AKA lemon chicken and pot stickers.

Through my many years of Chinese family-style dining, I have learned a slight appreciating for what would be quality cooking.  This restaurant would be A-OK in my book.  I was told it was cheap and good (and it was fair enough seeing as I did not pay the bill).  

Notable entrees would be the fried tofu over bok choy, the roast chicken and the walnut shrimp.  I was told that the garlic crab was just OK.  Peanuts for appetizer.  Mysterious dessert soup compliments the end of the meal.

Not bad but nothing stood out.  If I were in the neighborhood hankering for some Chinese cuisine, I would give it a 50/50 chance I would go here.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
This is the go-to destination for our big family gatherings every year
It has a great variety of seafood, decent taste, and extremely cheap price. 
As a matter of fact, I would say price is the biggest factor that will keep me going back to this place.

Definitely would recommend this place to a big group of people who have some desire for varieties of seafood.
author: Jun W.

description: We ordered to-go. The seafood plate we had was NOT the best. They smelled very fishy, so I'm not sure if it was over cooked or under cooked. It was a seafood hong kong style chowmein. Then the portions of our beef and broccoli... eh, there was way more rice than the beef and broccoli.
author: Neeenya J.

description: The food is more delicious as a late night/early morning thing. not expensive and always fresh!
author: Linda A.

description: 2 and a half stars. The half star is only for the very cheap items. I ordered sizzling scallops and shrimp, (no scallops, all small shrimp, and HUGE pieces of onions and bell peppers), Then cod and tender greens, nothing special. mu shu shrimp (shrimp was like those tiny little dried shrimps, just not used to that for my mu shu) Lastly, we ordered eggplant and garlic, under the vegetarian section, the dish was loaded with pork. and was super slimy and sloppy, so I dumped it. In fact we dumped most of it.  Lastly, I had trouble sleeping and got up like for times to guzzle down 3-4 very large glades of water. MSG attack!!! AAAAAHHHH.  Still feel so dirty.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Ridiculous sized portions at a ridiculous low prices. OK if you looking for a dining experience with great service and ambiance then this is NOT the place. But if you want good food at prices from the 80s and HUGH portions then this is the place. I was pleasantly surprised. Its a wonder how they make money.
author: K M.

description:
OMG, I'm surprise of all the good ratings for this restaurant!

Our destination for the past special event was the seafood restaurant a few doors away, but because they didn't only took reservations this day we tried the nearest one!

food is good for the cheap price! BUT:

-fish tank was dirty and there was a dead fish inside of it as well.
-we're asian too, what are people staring at our table for?
-server wasn't good at taking orders. Very RUDE!!! 
-cups were blurry, had to wipe with napkins twice
-little flies on 2 out of 10 cups.
-you guys never heard of the question "what oil you use to cook?"
-server just drops the platter on the table (some juices got on my dad)
-food was late
-our party of 10 hardly got attention
-we didn't get oranges like the other tables at the end of the meal!!

THEN

walked out leaving my sister in there with the packed leftover foods. She calls me saying the server said that the tip was short $3, it should be even $10. Are you serious? We give tips because we feel you deserve it, but not because we have to! FYI- $7 is a lot in this economy I felt hesitated to even leave that much money for the kind of service we got!! Again we tip accordingly to the service that we get.
author: S F.

description:
Nothing special about this place. Just ordinary Cantonese style food if you are having Asian food cravings. 

Dishes range from $5-$9.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Good solid familly style Cantonese food. Nothing fancy but not a dive. It's a type of place where you look at the customers eating there and think "must be good food at good prices"...and it is. They have a good variety of dishes in fairly large portions. Every time I go there (mostly takeout) I look at what people are eating to see what I could try next time. There is so much to choose from in Cantonese cuisine that you need to look at what other people (preferably Chinese) order as well to appreciate the wide variety of Cantonese food.
author: Stanley H.

description: Cheap food but not especially good tasting and place is worn and not particularly clean.    We went here for a Saturday lunch partly because the ABC bakery was so rude and unpleasant to us.   Seated promptly but the tables were very crowded and tight.   The dark green tables and carpet had seen better days but service was fairly fast and friendly.   I had the house chow mein (crispy fried), beef and tofu rice plate and a "snail" rice plate.  Food wasn't particularly good and on greasy side.   Beef tofu, for example, was so thickly covered in corn starch, it formed a gelatin around the beef to make it almost inedible.  Chow mein had lots of stuff on it but most of the veggies were very old and poor quality.  Whoever did the cutting made the ingredients strange  and odd shaped -- never saw chicken pieces literally butchered to pieces.   Room had a smell of smoke and this was coming from the people outside smoking.  I think there are other places in the area that might be better but this will do if you're in a pinch.   (Others warn you not to go into the restroom so we stayed away).
author: Bad News S.

description:
I came here with a group of friends and one who highly recommends this place for its large portion and cheap price.  The food was fairly tasty and portions were more than the average Chinese restaurant.  Each of us ordered an item off the menu which includes...

**** Fillet of cod with green peppers
*****Salt Pepper short ribs
**** Steamed mince pork with salted fish (Chinese comfort food)
***   Garlic and spicy sauce sautéed eggplant
**** Bamboo with beef stew chow mi fun (not on the menu but they will make it)

We came back the next day to order their cheap $3.95 rice plate which for me is enough for a 2 day meal.
**    Mince beef, raw egg over rice 
***  Tofu, bar-b-que pork over rice

As I am waiting for our order to go, I can't help but noticed there appears to be several green health inspection result notices.  All have the numbers hidden behind another piece of paper.  Hmmmm.... This is not exactly a clean establishment.
author: Nanette L.

description:
I got a good recommandation from a co-worker who always lead me to great resturants but some how this one didn't work out.  Maybe  because I went with the set dinner menu instead of picking the individual items.  Somehow what turns me away is the sour looking manager/cashiers.  And surprisingly, I am never the kind who nick pick on what the staff looks like and tolerates bad service.  This place actually have very good service, quick and nice servers.  Somehow is the tough looking manager that is kind of scaring me away.
I appologize to my dinner companion for taking them here. Yikes, I owe you dinner for sure.
The break down:  we have the set  menu for 2-4 people; we sup the steam chicken into the crispy chicken.  The  salt ,pepper shrimp is OK, The greens done right.  Chicken tastes old like left over.  it didn't look like the yelp photo.  The ribs is   yuck oily full of fat hanging and hardly any meat on it which taste like some kind of cheap cast offs.  I know each order must have some fatty ones on it but I tried to bite into one and then another and each bite is the same fats hanging on bone covered in brown glaze which pretty much masked the fat.  The one part that ticks me off is the rice is not includes.  The price on the set menu is $24.99 when plus tax and tips this dinner is well over $30+  Too much for a cheap chinese joint  (considering we didn't eat the ribs,) 4 dishes plus soup of the day.    I see other people having nice dinner next to us, clams, and whole steam fish.  They have a little dish of salted peanuts when you are waiting for your food.  My firend said if the food  is so lousy the decor should make up for it, sorry dude what decor?  This is a place filled with locals, and I guess they know how to order what's good on the menu you will enjoy your meal,
author: Mar H.

description: I went with my hairstylist and her daughter to this eatery on 6-1-12 10:00pm'sh.  Since there are not many options in the evening, she decided that we should come here. We ordered chicken with black mushrooms, beef with chinese brocolli, sizzling rice soup with seafood and the service was decent. I thought the food is good with reasonable prices, If I'm in the sunset, I'll come here again.
author: Jer W.

description: Why does everyone go to ABC bakery?  Do you know that this place is also open late night to 2 or 3?  Okay, so I don't eat in this restaurant, but the prices are reasonable and they are conscientious about not feeding you melted plastic.  This is one of the few places that lines their take out boxes with foil so the heat doesn't permeate the plastic and melt your food into it.  Take out is typically generous and decent.  Regular chinese food with more than fair prices.
author: Tony And Candace T.

description:
CHEAP!  CHEAP! CHEAP!  I'm talking about the prices....

We ordered an order of beef chow fun and salty fish and chicken fried rice and it only cost $9.50 for both!  Not only that, the box was filled with chow fun and fried rice....and not only that, it was packed with beef, chicken and salty fish!  How does this place make money???  Anyhow, the quality was ok...decent...don't expect the best quality.  Two orders was enough to feed 4-5 adults!
author: Katniss B.

description:
If you want a hole in the wall chinese place to eat at, this is it.  First time I walked into this place I was thinking 'oh god, why are we eating here'. As soon as you're seated, you're greeted with that distinct 'sticky seat' feel that all chinese eateries of similar pedigree exhibit. As soon as I sat down in the sticky seat, I do what I always do in these eateries. I check to make sure all eating utensils, plates, cups are clean and free of food residue left over from the human dishwasher in the back.  Once the hot tea comes, I grab a spare tea cup from another table, and proceed to sterilize my chopsticks in the tea.  Excessive? Perhaps. If you think so though, don't ever go into the kitchen area of such establishments.

The food itself is actually very good. The seafood is incredibly fresh, and the prices are very cheap compared to other places. The portions are large. During lunch hours, this place is a favorite amongst chinese construction workers. This particular clientele favors establishments with HUGE portions for CHEAP. 

Which pretty much sums up this place. They have HUGE portions for CHEAP.  The food is good.  Just order it to go.
author: Wes C.

description:
If you want good local chinese food, order from this place. I usually eat from here once a month but it's mostly take out. Inside, the restaurant isn't the nicest smelling place and not the cleanest, but the food stands up on it's own. 
The prices are very affordable and they give you large portions. I usually order the Mongolian Beef lunch special (which comes with rice) and it's only $3.50.  The Mongolian Beef has got to be one of the best I've ever had. I can't even finish the lunch special it's so big. 

If you're local, I suggest you try this place out.
author: Jen Y.

description:
I have five words for you all:
