Salt Pepper Fried Chicken Wings.

18 pieces per order. 

Crispy, juicy, flavorful. Highly addictive. Don't plan on sharing! 
 
People talk about "the other place about 5 minutes away" for chicken wings, but that's just because they don't know any better...these are the best d*mn fried chicken wings in town.

Sidenote: the food here is otherwise fresh, tasty and the orders are huge; tremendous bang for your buck factor.

Worth the drive from WHEREVER you are for the wings alone, so wipe that drool off your mouth, send the map to your cellular device immediately and I'll see you there soon!
author: J C.

description:
my family and i have been coming here for over 10 years and they havn't changed much except for the upgrades on tables and chairs + maybe a paint job inside? 

the food has always been the same. i've never had any issue with the quality of their food and their service has been good.

i always get the fresh fish here, none of that generic chinese food like the fries walnut prawns or salt and pepper pork chop or beef chow mein kind of thing. you gotta get the real chinese food!

get that white rice slap some chicken and salted fish egg plant from a clat pot with some of that fresh fish fllet with pea pods on that!
author: Kenny L.

description:
I don't live in the Sunset District anymore, but whenever I get the chance, I eat at Oriental Seafood.

The place isn't the most impressive when it comes to ambiance or cleanliness, but the flavors and cooking style is right up to par.  I visit too many Chinese restaurants that under-season or over-season their food, but this place is just right.

The lobster noodle is good and the black bean sauce clams are always a hit.  The fresh shrimp (still swimming in the tanks) and ling cod made two ways (Soup and Stirfry w/ veggies) for special occasions are a must.  The salt and pepper crab or green onion ginger crab never disappoints.

With cheap prices and the abundance of fresh seafood dishes, this restaurant will remain a mainstay on my Chinese restaurant list.
author: Curt L.

description:
Cheap, greasy, huge portions of chinese food!!
It was Sunday at 9 pm and this place was 80% full.  So we thought we'd check it out.  My Cantonese is horrible and I usually try to go with somebody that can speak way better and knows what to order, but I gotta learn someday, might as well start now.  The waitress understood my chin-glish so the experience wasn't bad.    
We were starving and our eyes were bigger than our stomach, so we ordered WAY too much food.  3 reg dishes and fried rice... for 2 people... talk about leftover galore!!
anyways.. they also gave us soup and dessert on the house.
author: Karena L.

description:
One of my favorite Chinese joints. Really, really solid Chinese food. Everything I've EVER eaten her has always been if not good than great.

Nothing annoys me more than when my "salt and pepper" or "fried" foot is soft and soggy. Oriental does it right - wonderfully crispy and utterly delicious - not to mention plates under $6. Holla!

That being said, your money sure as hell doesn't go to the decor. But really, I've seen worse. For a Chinese restaurant, the service is also pretty good. So really, just swallow your comments (pun intended) and take a bite of those delicious, wonderfully and heavenly greasy, Chinese dishes, and be amazed.
author: Kris Q.

description: This is my favorite cheap seafood place, perfect place for live rock fish, or live coral shrimps, or live geoducks.  And the price is right!
author: Rachel W.

description: OK you want down and dirty Chinese food NO fuss, NO atmosphere, just a bunch of screaming Chinese people talking with their mouths full, doesn't sound appealing huh? Well that's why I prefer to get my food to go here. The place is a hole but the food is CHEAP and good! They have traditional Chinese food and also some Americanized stuff like tomato beef chow mein that I like and they do very well! There is soo much food in one order you can share.
author: Karen T.

description:
Great service! I won't forget the time I brought playing cards to dinner and we played with one of the workers. I would have to say the food is not that bad and the prices are great! No where will you find the Seafood Pan fried noodles for $5.00!!!!!! 

Sadly I don't go here anymore because of the things I've seen here. 
Two times I had hair in my food and the the last time I was there was the last straw. I like these guys and don't want to hurt them too much. So I'll leave it as is.

I saw that some guy clamed they had a 60 but they have an 84 rating.
Add Http:// to link to view yelp doesn't allow linking.

dph-extranet2.sfdph.org:7777/pls/eeop_htmldb/f?p=132:2:66043617992721::NO::P2_LOCATIONID:2292
author: Stanley C.

description:
it's been a while since dining here. i remember odering off the chalk board for their seafood specials. prices very reasonable. 

tables cramp together. bathrooms crapped also. ymmv.
author: Victor G.

description: Decent Chinese food. Their salt and pepper pork chop is good~ :)
author: KBs C.

description:
NEVER EVER coming here EVER again! I just had the worst experience possible at a restaurant. It was around 9-10 at night, and there were only about 2-3 tables filled when we walked in. There was one table in the middle, filled with a couple drunk guys, who just happened to be smoking there. The manager asked them to stop about two times, then ended up drinking two beers with them. Needless to say, having people smoke in a restaurant, which is ILLEGAL, is a big no in my book. We asked them to stop smoking, and things didn't go well. Bottles were  thrown , plates were broken, and a chair was also thrown. Let's just leave it at that. 

Prices were cheap and the food wasn't that good. Everything here, you can probably find at another Chinese restaurant somewhere else in the neighborhood. 

The only thing going for this restaurant is the price of the food. The taste wasn't good, it was too salty for my liking, but a fairly big portion. 

I would recommend this for people who just want a quick and cheap meal, for anyone who doesn't care AT ALL about the taste of their food. The experience here was just too much for me. I am avoiding this restaurant forever, no matter how cheap their prices are.
author: R F.

description:
Why is everyone calling it a "hole in the wall"? It ain't fancy, but it is not quite hidden away or super tiny to warrant that overused term. I'd call it "basic" or "sparse". 
This is a cheapskate's delight! What I've enjoyed most are the GI-NORMOUS PORTIONS of "sup chow" chow fun and fried rice. I saw a waitress serve on an oval dish chow fun stacked over 4 inches high. Ridiculous. I thought maybe the table ordered a double portion. But when I opened my take out, the plastic container was filled to the top. Could've fed me for three meals! That would work out to under $2.00 PER MEAL! I once took a couple orders to my parent's place and my mom was impressed. She knows a good deal when she sees it!

UPDATE: The rock cod fillet w/tender greens isn't the freshest tasting. Stick with the whole steamed fish if you want fresh. Once I sat next to a table doing the full-on b-day banquet with lobster and sizzling platters. It looked grand. No one goes to a hole in the wall for their birthday.
author: Stan P.

description:
This place is tiny, the mirror they have on the wall makes it look so much bigger when you walk past it on the street. Order to go instead. They give you enough food in one order of noodles that can feed 3 people.

on the downside, i called in and ordered beef chow fun. they told me it was going to be ready in 20 minutes. 20 minutes later, i arrive at the restaurant and they tell me they dont have anymore rice noodles... how could they possible run out of rice noodles?
author: Sarah L.

description: Come here for late night dining after the bars/clubs.  How's the food?  One of the better tasting chinese late night joints in the city.  The guy there is the host, waiter, cashier, dishwasher and cook all in one.  So don't be surprised if he disappears for 5-10 minutes at a time...he in the back cooking some food!!
author: Patrick C.

description: waited 50 minutes for a single dish pickup order. make sure you call in to check if the orders are ready to pickup before heading to the restaurant for your to go order.
author: Peaceatom ..

description: went to this place about a week ago, the first thing you notice is its drafty and kinda small. the second thing you notice is its not a clean place. I used the restroom and a green garbage can (full size)  was in the bathroom. to the FOOD it was good to very good , honey walnut prawn, a vegetable order,crab and a beef dish total $50.00. overall the would go back but expect the negs. waitress service was average .
author: Howard J.

description: Not bad... a bit more on the pricey end... for not so decent food... ugh.. probably should've went someone else, where i paid the price, and the food is better.
author: Monika T.

description:
I'll summarize the main points about this restaurant, so you don't have to read all the reviews:

Taste?  Not bad.  Nothin to write home about.

Price?  Dirt cheap.  Unfortunately, you may very well get some dirt with your dish.

Portions?  HUGE!

Service? The waitstaff are OK, but you'll be waiting quite a while for your food, even when it's not crowded. 

Cleanliness?  UGH!  You don't want to know.  I'm surpised this place hasn't been shut down.

Overall, a good takeout place, but not one for dining in unless you want cheap seafood.
author: Jane C.

description:
I don't usually want to eat Cantonese food but last Sunday I was too hungry.  The usual places I go to on Noriega and 31st were packed so I decided  to try Oriental Seafood. BIG MISTAKE.

We ordered two dishes, house chow mein and wor wonton. The calamari in the house chow mein was SPOILED! It was so gross. I picked out all the calamari from the chow mein and put it in a bowl. I was not going to complain, but then the waitress came by and said, "Next time you should tell me that you don't like calamari so we don't put it in the dish!"  I was so mad. I told her that the calamari was spoiled and she did not even say anything. Instead she just walked away to the cash register and ignored us. 

I am never going back to this place. I don't really expect much from these "hold in the wall" Chinese places, but that waitress had some nerve!
author: vernice l.

description:
so the lobster noodles are good
so is their fried fish (i actually have no idea what it's called cause i didn't order)
people here are really nice and helpful
you know how chinese restaurants are generally seen as grimy, cheap places with bad service?
I HATE THAT SHIT
so it's nice to be at a chinese restaurant that somewhat defies the stereotypes.
oh, and the prices are not bad at all.
author: Edmund C.

description:
Dirt cheap and decent food, but I noticed they have a score of 60 from the Department of Public Health, so I decided to look them up on the DPH website. I don't think I'll be going back until they address some of these issues. See for yourself:

http://dphwww.sfdph.org/eh/Violations/Loc_CurrentViol.asp?LocationID=2292
author: a a.

description: I hate cooking and usually I get home pretty late so this a great late night take out place . I love how when I say I want to order a takeout they always say " what do you want?" all gruff and mean. Totally reminds me of me working in the restaurant business. Cheap and huge portions.I always order the salt and pepper chicken wings and Singapore chow fun.You definitely quench your Chinese food craving at this place
author: Sophia C.

description: This place has good food for a very affordable menu.  The ambiance is a bit hard on the eyes (literally -- bug lights) and the service is not your best but they are well worth the sacrifice for what you get for the good deal.  The portions are always generous and the dishes are authentic Chinese. It's a good place to go chow with a big group of people and not a good place to go on a romantic date.  Try the set dinners and you will get a sampler of their menu.

This place is hit or miss.  Most of the time it's a miss.  If this place had consistency, especially in terms of freshness of ingredients (ie their seafood) I would give it a higher rating.  

Sometimes the seafood is too old to serve; yet they still serve it.  For example, we ordered the black bean clams; they tasted old and disugsting.  What's up with that?
author: Jeff H.

description: This is one of my favorite To-Go resturant if I don't feel like cooking for the nite. One of the reason is, the parent of my son's classmate run this place. So we know them for long time. The other reason is the food and service. For under $30, I can feed my whole family of 5. The only complain will be the restroom....tho
author: Jason L.

description: my boyfriend and i always order to go here. good prices good food quick and delicious what more do you want when youre hungry? :]
author: melanie t.

description: Good rock cod with bell pepper in black bean sauce clay pot. Their string beans in hunan sauce wasn't too bad, but as it is a "seafood" restaurant, and many people were eating seafood (fish shrimp scallop etc etc), perhaps we should have ordered something more along those lines... Oh well maybe next time
author: Yosie G.

description: Cheap good food.  That about sums it up.  The place is small so there's often a wait.  I recommend making reservations, especially for large groups.
author: Stacey L.

description: Eh.. it's sorta cheap. Food isn't always great, but it's okay. If you come at lunch, you'll bump into LOTS of contruction workers here on their lunch break.
author: Katherine C.

description: I went here with a large group of about 16 people and they were able to accommodate us.  But as for us vegetarians, it was so-so.  The eggplant dish was yummy, but a bit greasy, and the tofu/mushroom dish was ok, but tasted like they used the same oil they used for meat dishes.  I was unfortunately seated right next to the fish tank, if that's what you can call it.  I really just wanted to free the little fishies from the nasty water.   Even if I were not vegetarian, I would not want to eat anything that had to survive in that environment.  Yuck.  A sad life for those fish.
author: Jennifer P.

description: If you want really really great Chinese seafood, this is the place to be! It's a somewhat hole in the wall, seating is often tight, and there's a wait for big parties when you don't have a reservation but all in all it's well worth it!
author: janet j.

description: All I can say is that this place is DIRTY! Try wiping the table with a napkin and turn it over. You'll be surprised at how dirty it is. The food is okay, but I feel that it's a little on the greasy side. The price is decent, I guess. Also, one thing to keep in mind, try not to sit near the fish tank because it is disgusting. The water was like all dark and murky, you could barely see the fishes. Well, if you don't mind sitting next to dirty water and fish, then everything should be okay. But if your a clean freak like me, stay away.
author: Vivian C.

description: Cheap but not good!!  I ordered steam chicken w/ ginger & scallions, fried squid, honey walnut prawns, salt & pepper porkchops.  Chicken was overcooked so it tasted like rubber w/ ginger & scallions, squid was the worst undercooked w/ slimey batter and globs of garlic, and shrimp & porkchops barely made average.  I will not be returning anytime in the future.  I can't believe this place actually got 3 stars from my fellow yelpers. It is a shame.  Oh yeah if I knew ahead of time that they got a health score of 60 I would have steered clear!!
author: Nancy K.

description: Food's great....huge portions too...and probably the cheapest price around if you compare with other chinese restaurants in the Sunset.  we go there at least once a week
author: Mich C.

description:
hella dirty...hella cheap...hella food

that pretty much sums up the restaurant as a whole.  We ordered the Westlake Beef Soup, Salty Fish Fried Rice, Beef Chow Fun, and Seafood Pan Fried Noodles.  The portion they give is pretty ridiculous, enough to feed a small army.  However, the taste is ehhh...food is either plain or overly salty.  You get what you pay for.  The 2 star rating is for the Westlake Beef Soup...pretty good in my opinion as a Westlake Beef Soup connoisseur.  If you're hungry for some cheap and dirty chinese food and only care about portion, come here.  Otherwise, there are like 20 others within a 2 block radius.
author: Jo E.

description: The ambiance is not great, but food is cheap and good.  Portions are also very generous.  We usually get take out from here when we're too lazy to cook.  Their Peking spareribs are great, and only for $5.95!  I order tomato beef chow mein every time I come, even though it's not printed on the menu.  Their tomato beef chow mein is the best I've had.
author: J C.

description: good for cheap,local chinese food or take-out if you're in the sunset. i really like their honey walnut prawns and clay pot dishes here. my family usually comes here for get-togethers and i'm usually not dissapointed after eating here. not the cleanest place, but certainly not dirty. for the price i think it's a really good place.
author: Douglas F.

description: My family and I come here every now and then.  We love this place for the prices and huge plates of food.  We love their lobster e-mein, honey walnut prawns, beef chow mein, etc. The quailty and quantity of the food is quite consistant.  Love this place.
author: liliana l.

description: this is your basic neighborhood chinese restaurant - nothing fancy, you don't come here for the ambiance. i've never had a negative experience. it's a great place to get take out because it's cheap and their portions are huge. an order of chow mein is $3.50 and you can eat it for days. great for parties.
author: julia t.

description: This is one of our family's favorite authentic cantonese cuisine restaurant in SF.  Your experience should be above average if you know what to order.  Our favorites are:  all lunch specials on the Chinese menu (comes with soup and rice), lobster yee-mein, Fuk Kien fried rice, and the $68 seafood dinner (also on the Chinese menu).  This place is crowded daily for lunch and dinner.  I definitely recommend making dinner reservations for this place.
author: jenny t.
